title: Bildad’s First Speech: Repent and Be Restored
summary: Bildad speaks, defending God’s justice. He argues that Job’s children must have sinned and that if Job were truly upright, God would restore him. He appeals to traditional wisdom to back up his claims.

faq.question: What does Bildad claim about Job’s children?
faq.answer: That they died because of their own sin.

faq.question: What is Bildad’s solution for Job?
faq.answer: To repent and seek God, who rewards the righteous.
